Andrew Johns stood down over airport incident Channel Nine stands down Andrew Johns from Sunday's NRL grand final broadcast following an intoxicated incident at Toowoomba airport on Friday night.
PT0M54S http://www.canberratimes.com.au/action/externalEmbeddedPlayer?id=d-43ve8 620 349 October 4, 2015 Autoplay On Off Video feedback Video settings Nine dumps Johns from grand final coverage J ohns apologises for 'disgraceful' behaviour Broadcaster and Channel Nine commentator Ray Hadley has reproached former footballer and television personality Andrew Johns for alleged inappropriate behaviour at an airport last week.
"I don't understand the mindset of someone who would make a comment like that," Hadley said of Johns' actions, which are alleged to include asking a woman for a kiss and later asking whether she had had caesarean births for her three children.
Photo of Andrew Johns apparently asleep in Toowoomba Airport posted onto Facebook today . Photo by: Facebook / Helen Wright 3rd October 2015 
Hadley described the comments as "abhorrent" on air on Monday morning after the historic NRL Grand Final on Sunday from which Johns was excluded.
Advertisement Channel Nine sports director Steve Crawley confirmed the decision to stand Johns down Saturday afternoon.
"He will not be on air for any part of our coverage," he said at the time.
The relationship with Nine was also mentioned by Hadley, who is a paid commentator for Nine's Today Show .
"It couldn't have come at a worse time for him," Mr Hadley said. "He's in negotiations with both Channel Nine and Foxtel about his broadcasting future."
"I hope Andrew understands why he was suspended."
Hadley also urged Johns to see this moment as a turning point.
"Andrew Johns is at a crossroad in his life and his career. He's 41. And I know he seeks counsel from some wise heads. He needs to wake up to himself. He needs to start behaving himself in a manner befitting one of the game's immortals.
"I can't imagine how the other immortals are feeling in light of the comments passed by Andrew Johns. They'd be mortified by them. Mortified."
Foxtel and Channel Nine declined to comment on Monday.
Nine was under pressure last week over AFL Footy Show personality Billy Brownless who described a woman and her daughter walking past a venue as "strippers". 
The AFL subsequently put stars of the AFL Footy Show on notice that management "doesn't accept" sexist remarks against women.
